total_subquestions_ys: Q1: Identify the rows that contain the number 2 in the input grid.
Q2: Identify the rows that contain the number 1 in the input grid.
Q3: For each row containing the number 1, check if there are two consecutive 1s.
Q4: If there are two consecutive 1s, keep them as they are. If there is only one 1, replace it with 0.
Q5: For each row containing the number 1, if there is a single 1 followed by a 0, replace the 0 with a 1.
Q6: Replace all remaining single 1s with 0s.
Q7: Combine the modified rows from Q4, Q5, and Q6 with the rows containing 2s from Q1 to form the output grid.
Q1: Identify the rows that contain the number 2 in the input grid.
Q2: Identify the rows that contain the number 1 in the input grid.
Q3: For the rows identified in Q1, check if there are any 1s in the same row in the input grid.
Q4: For the rows identified in Q2, check if there are any 2s in the same row in the input grid.
Q5: If there are 1s in the rows identified in Q3, replace the 1s with 0s in the output grid.
Q6: If there are 2s in the rows identified in Q4, keep the 2s in the same position in the output grid.
Q7: For the rows identified in Q2, if there are two consecutive 1s, keep them in the same position in the output grid.
Q8: For the rows identified in Q2, if there is a single 1, replace it with 0 in the output grid.
Q9: For the rows identified in Q2, if there are three consecutive 1s, replace the middle 1 with 0 in the output grid.
Q10: Keep all the other elements in the grid the same as in the input grid.
Q1: Identify the rows that contain the number 2 in the input grid.
Q2: Identify the rows that contain the number 1 in the input grid.
Q3: For the rows identified in Q2, check if there are two consecutive 1s.
Q4: If there are two consecutive 1s, check if there is a single 1 in the same column in the row above or below.
Q5: If there is a single 1 in the same column in the row above or below, replace the single 1 with 0.
Q6: For the rows identified in Q2, check if there is a single 1.
Q7: If there is a single 1, check if there are two consecutive 1s in the same column in the row above or below.
Q8: If there are two consecutive 1s in the same column in the row above or below, replace the single 1 with two consecutive 1s.
Q9: Repeat the process for all rows identified in Q2.
Q10: The final grid after all replacements is the output grid.
select_new_ys: Q1: Identify the rows that contain the number 2 in the input grid.
Q2: Identify the rows that contain the number 1 in the input grid.
Q3: For each row containing the number 1, check if there are two consecutive 1s.
Q4: If there are two consecutive 1s, keep them as they are. If there is only one 1, replace it with 0.
Q5: For each row containing the number 1, if there is a single 1 followed by a 0, replace the 0 with a 1.
Q6: Replace all remaining single 1s with 0s.
Q7: Combine the modified rows from Q4, Q5, and Q6 with the rows containing 2s from Q1 to form the output grid.
